The length of the repetend of 1\/p is equal to the order of 10 modulo p. If 10 is a primitive root modulo p, the repetend length is equal to p − 1; if not, the repetend length is a factor of p − 1. This result can be deduced from Fermat's little theorem, which states that 10p−1 ≡ 1. The base-10 repetend of the reciprocal of any prime number greater than 5 is divisible by 9.
